discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
UPS and Cloud stroage - UPS for the server to continue to work during short power and cloud storage for the data to be stored off site.

questions.question_text:
A security director is designing a company's disaster recovery procedure. The information security officer wants the servers to continue to function during short power outages, and important documents should be stored off site in case of a catastrophe at the datacenter.
Which of the following would BEST fulfill these requirements? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
If the hard drive is not recognized, the system cannot find a device to boot from. This would typically result in a message like B. No boot device available.

Option C, “Operating system not found”, might be displayed if the hard drive was recognized but the operating system could not be loaded, which is not the case here. The other options, “NTLDR not found” and “BIOS ROM checksum error”, are related to other types of errors.
How come its not C? "No OS found"?

comments.content: Because the hard drive is not recognized. If the the hard drive was recognized and it still doesn’t boot, then the answer would be C.

questions.question_text:
Ann, a user, calls a technician and reports that her PC will not boot. The technician confirms the memory, power supply, and monitor are all working. The technician runs internal diagnostics on the PC, but the hard drive is not recognized.
Which of the following messages will be displayed?

choices.C: Indicate to the developer that formal approval is needed; then, the IT team should investigate the software and the impact it will have on the organization before installing the software.
choices.D: Install the software and run a full system scan with antivirus software to confirm that the operating system is free of malicious software.
choices.B: Run a scan on the downloaded installation file to confirm that it is free of malicious software, install the software, and document the software installation process.
choices.A: Contact the software vendor to obtain the license for the user, and assist the user with installation once the license is purchased.

discussion.content:
"The developer states that the management team approved the business use of this software."

Sounds like it has already gone through the approval process, I think the answer is B scan the file because somebody else downloaded it and if it is OK then install it.

Selected Answer: C
Every software you install on work computers has to go through the formal approval process and its business requirement, followed by standard licensing.

questions.question_text:
In an organization with a standardized set of installed software, a developer submits a request to have new software installed. The company does not currently have a license for this software, but the developer already downloaded the installation file and is requesting that the technician install it. The developer states that the management team approved the business use of this software.
Which of the following is the BEST action for the technician to take?
Which of the following threats commonly relies on DNS poisoning and spoofing to exploit an unknowing victim?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. Man-in-the-middle

DNS spoofing is a type of attack in which a malicious actor intercepts DNS request and returns the address that leads to its own server instead of the real address. Hackers can use DNS spoofing to launch a man-in-the-middle attack and direct the victim to a bogus site that looks like the real one, or they can simply ...
Definitely C. Quick Google search will confirm that DNS Spoofing/Poisoning is used for man-in-the-middle attacks

questions.question_text:
A user is having network printing issues. The user indicates printing was working fine moments ago, but now there are no printers displayed in Microsoft Word.
Which of the following should a technician check FIRST?

discussion.content: Check FIRST = D. The print spooler service, if it doesn't work try C. The printer driver version

choices.A: The toner volume in the printer
choices.B: The USB cable from the PC to the printer
